input: I'm sweating, shaky, and my glucometer reads 55 mg/dL.
A pregnant woman with gestational diabetes keeps getting fasting readings around 130 mg/dL.
Crushing chest pain shooting down my left arm—do I chew aspirin first or call an ambulance?
My father has Type 1 diabetes and just injected insulin but didn't eat anything—now he's confused and dizzy.
I’ve had Type 2 diabetes for years, but today I’m vomiting, breathing fast, and my breath smells fruity.
I get chest pain every time I climb stairs, but it goes away when I rest.
My heart feels like it’s skipping beats and sometimes racing for no reason.
My grandma's legs are swollen, she's short of breath lying down, and needs 2 pillows to sleep.
My blood sugar levels are always high even with medication, and I'm not pregnant.
My kidneys failed suddenly after severe dehydration from diarrhea.
I’ve had diabetes for years and now my doctor says my kidney function is below 30%.
My lab report shows potassium is 6.8 mmol/L and I’m feeling weak and nauseous.
I missed dialysis this week and now I have a headache, vomiting, and feel very weak.
I was diagnosed with Type 1 diabetes at 12 and now I inject insulin every day.
I’ve been dizzy, have chest discomfort, and feel like I’m about to faint.
